required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction Model for Recanalization Outcome Evaluation of Ischemic Stroke Using Multimodal CT
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction Model for Recanalization Outcome Evaluation of Ischemic Stroke Using Multimodal CT

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effect of novel imaging biomarkers/ imaging patterns based on multi-model CT on patients selection/stratification for therapy decision support in large vessel acute ischemic stroke

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients Patients with cerebral ischemia sympton of anterior circulation or posterior circulation onset in 24 hours were included. A neurological evaluation (Modified Rankin Scale and NIHSS); physical examination, including measurement of weight (kg) and vital signs (supine systolic and diastolic blood pressure, heart rate) ; time from sympton onset to enrollment were recorded.
Imaging protocols:
CT scan protocols: No enhancement computed tomography(NECT) , computed tomography angiography(CTA), computed tomography perfusion(CTP)
Contrast agent:
CTA: Omniscan 40-50ml, 5ml/s; saline solution 50ml, 5ml/s
CTP: Omniscan 50ml, 5ml/s; saline solution 50ml, 5ml/s
Imaging evaluation:
Treatment:
Intravenous recombinant tissue plasminogen activator(rtPA), endovascular therapy and conventional treatment including neuro protection, ante-platelet and statin.
Follow up:
Five days, one month, three months and one year after imaging follow up and clinical stroke event and modified Rankin Scale(mRS).

primary_outcome.description: Finding the effect of novel imaging biomarkers/imaging patterns to provide therapy decision support in patients with large vessel acute ischemic stroke

secondary_outcome.description: Finding the predictive value of novel imaging biomarkers/ imaging patterns on therapy response (recanalization therapy)
Finding the predictive value of novel imaging biomarkers/ imaging patterns on 90-day functional outcome
Finding the predictive value of novel imaging biomarkers/ imaging patterns on final infarction volume
Validating novel imaging biomarkers/ imaging patterns in the decision support of acute posterior circulation stroke
Validating the acute lesion identification and recurrence prediction of multi-model CT in non-disabling cerebrovascular event

arm_group.description: Ischemic stroke patients with sympton onset in 24 hours

intervention.description: No enhancement computed tomography , computed tomography angiography, computed tomography perfusion imaging

study_pop.textblock: Ischemic stroke patients with sympton onset in 24 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cerebral ischemic sympton of anterior circulation onset in 24 hours
- Large vessel anterior and posterior circulation occlusion on MR or CT angiography
- Minor stroke (NIHSSâ‰¤3) and TIA
- All CT examination performed according to study protocol
- Signed informed consent obtained from the patient or patient's legally authorized representative
- Having complete medical history and clinical follow up
- Imaging data can be processed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute intracranial hemorrhage
- Pre-existing medical, neurological or psychiatric disease that would confound the neurological, functional, or imaging evaluations
- Pregnancy
- Known allergy to iodine previously refractory to pretreatment medications
- Renal Failure (serum creatinine > 2.0 or Glomerular Filtration Rate [GFR] < 30)
- History of sever kidney disease as an adult, including tumor or transplant surgery, or family history of kidney failure
- Severe cardiac insufficiency

responsible_party.investigator_title: Prediction model for recanalization outcome evaluation of ischemic stroke using multimodal CT
